str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To command, order, direct, bid. From a primary kello; 'hail'; to incite by word, i.e. Order.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A burial-place, sepulcher, tomb, grave. Masculine from thapto; a grave.
To make safe (secure, fast). From asphales; to render secure.
A conjunction, preposition and adverb of continuance, until.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Third. Ordinal from treis; third; neuter a third part, or a third time, thirdly.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To come, go.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To steal. A primary verb; to filch.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Apparently a primary word; a people.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(a) adj: dead, lifeless, subject to death, mortal, (b) noun: a dead body, a corpse. From an apparently primary nekus; dead.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Last, at the last, finally, till the end. A superlative probably from echo; farthest, final.
Feminine of planos; objectively, fraudulence; subjectively, a straying from orthodoxy or piety.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Worse, more severe. Irregular comparative of kakos; from an obsolete equivalent cheres; more evil or aggravated.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
First, before, principal, most important. Contracted superlative of pro; foremost.
